resources.string:
Bioinformatics involves computer technology to store and analyze biological data such as DNA/amino acid sequences. 

Scientists use databases to collect and organize biological information in order to better understand health, diseases, and gain insights. 

Now, Bioinformaticians are left to understand and interpret the big amount of data that has been collected by the aid of computers.

(Adams, 2022)

It is a field where Biology meets Computer Science and Statistics (Nattestad, 2017). Bioinformatics has been used for in silico analysis, which means conducted or produced by computer modeling or computer simulation (Fielden et al., 2002).

According to Edgar Da Silva (former Director Division of Life Sciences, UNESCO), Bioinformatics is part of Gold biotechnology, where this field uses computer science as a main driving force (DaSilva, 2004).
